intro: Tabernaemontana lundii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers bloom in clusters, making it a striking ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes.
